job_title: Director of Recruitment in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
From our executive leadership team to our front line associates, our ministry lives the mission. The pandemic has been challenging in many ways but the true colors of an organization show through in challenging times. Taking care of our associates so we can all provide the best care for our residents remains the priority. I see it everyday in the dedication of our team members. 
Great culture. Authentic leadership.
cons: Staffing shortages in general but especially in healthcare make recruiting and hiring challenging.

job_title: Director of Residential Services in Washington, IL
pros: This role allows for a lot of autonomy and experiences in all areas of managing the community; property management, clinical, sales, HR, marketing, you name it!
cons: The pros can also be considered cons as these areas are your responsibility. Home office is several hours away, so help is not readily available.

pros: No pros, worst company I’ve ever worked for. Daily pay option is the only benefit
cons: Horrible people, never enough cleaning supplies, residents aren’t properly taken care of

pros: The community I worked was great. They care about their employees. It was like a family
cons: I will say the corporate office is hard to take. They do not know how to work in the real world. Felt like the only concern was money. It is a not for profit company.

job_title: Residential Services Director in Washington, IL
pros: Christian Horizons stands for a mission that one can feel good about.
cons: Just like all long term care communities at this time, they are struggling with staffing and overwhelming changes in the industry which affects resident care.

pros: It is a Christian non profit, and employees there seem to strive to treat others with respect. For all the irrational ups and downs with Covid, they keep on moving forward. The residents are down to earth and a pleasure to be around.
cons: Like most SNFs, there is not enough workers. That means that more work gets put on the ones that are there, and the residents don’t get the best of the best care. Also they are requiring the vaccine

pros: A good family place lot of caring and loving worker to help you thru your journey
cons: No raises need more help

pros: Close to home. Nice coworkers.
cons: Insurance was expensive. Pay could be better.

job_title: Home Health Aide in Belleville, IL
pros: Flexible, lots of overtime, and great clients
cons: Management was rude and the pay was horrible

pros: The best reason to work at Corporate was my co-workers.  They were some of the best you could ever find.  Honest, Compassionate, and Caring people.
cons:
Too many Vice Presidents/Managers and not enough workers.  The top people in the company do not realize how good the people that are working there are.  
Morale was low because of this.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Lincoln, IL
pros: Drink the koolaid - you are lied too. On call all the time.  No one has a clue how to follow guidelines.
cons: On call all the time. Noone knows what they are doing - conditions of participation & Illinois regulations are not followed.

review_title: Love working here.  Coworkers are great, occ bad apple.  Responsive management
pros: Co-workers.  Pay good.  Free meals
cons: Unrealistic young staff.  No greener grass out there

review_title: Awesome nursing center, staff are happy to come to work.
pros: Always something fun going on.  Residents are generally happy with their care. Management is fair and consistent.
cons: The nature of the work is hard but worth it.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Bensenville, IL
pros: Most staff helpful, learned a lot from experience.  Management gave guidance through issues over the phone during off hours.
cons: Many new employees rotated to different units frequently.  Sometimes management did not respond to issues.

job_title: Activities Assistant in Crown Point, IN
pros: Flexible scheduling and a fun environment.
cons: Low paying compared to other nursing facilities. If you are not in management your ideas go unheard.

pros: Friendly and helpful staff co workers were easy to find and get help
cons: Alot of call ins worked short everyday not enough team players

pros: Working in a fulfilling industry, facilitating taking care of the residents at a assisted living home.
cons: The corporate policy seems to be very blase fair and lackadaisical at best.

pros: Always overtime available. Yearly pay increases are acceptable
cons: Need notice even when in dire situations for time to be allowed off.

pros: Team work on the floor
cons: No incentives for weekend / shift differential.  No repercussion for attendance. Terrible turnover (but this is healthcare).

pros: Great work environment, and work/home balance.
cons: On call is really the only con but it is once a month, so not bad.

pros: Wonderful Co-workers.  Tight knit family.  Definatly has a positive reputation in the community.
cons: No room for professional growth.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Crown Point, IN
pros: Best residents! Most people are great to work with!
cons: Be careful who you trust, reporting a manager per a resident's request will get you fired for something you didn't even do
